title: I made it to Plat today for the first time.
body:
Promo Series:
Game 1: Loss (Troll Ezreal saw it was my Plat promos and intentionally fed - literally flashing under turret and dancing)
Game 2: Loss (I was Jungle and all 3 lanes died almost simultaneously)
Game 3: Win (Spontaneous synergy with a random AD Carry as Thresh and I peeled for daaaaaaaaaaaaaaays)
Game 4: Win (Duo'ed with said AD Carry)
Game 5: Win (Duo'ed with him again)

Pretty happy. Now I need to decide whether I want to keep climbing or play casually.

EDIT: Also, any Rioter who sees this please take a look at the chat log from my first promo game and swiftly remove that disgusting Ezreal from the LoL community. It's a blatant, ban-worthy offence.

replies.body: enjoy it old man, for it shall be your last

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S8zMyLsVqZ8

its up to u if u wanna climb

That's Plat on EUW - arguably the most toxic server for Solo Q (even several EU CS and LCS players have had bans/suspensions from both competitive and general play as well as fines). I've been playing with Plats consistently since I got to Gold III last season and, apart from the higher average skill level of players, it seems no different to when I was climbing into Silver back in Season 3.
This was an OCE plat game i played 2 days ago
Your video shows the behavior of a childish player who feeds.. these types of people are in all levels of ranked play.

Hey, I'm just giving an example of not putting their hopes up when they get out of silver or bronze or even gold. Cuz thats what I thought at 1st, but found out that there wasn't much of a difference.

Plus, these videos are made for fun anyway! :)

Congratulations!

I'd keep trying to climb even if you play on a more casual basis.
If you do decide to stop playing ranked though, make sure you play a game every few weeks to avoid decay.
Further than I could probably ever get :)

It's only naming and shaming if I actually name and shame them - the operative word being naming. Pretty sure if Riot had an issue with this thread they'd delete it and probably still ban the player anyway.
